New Records: Lane Thomas hit the first postseason grand slam by a Cleveland player since Francisco Lindor slammed the Yankees in Game 2 of the ALDS in 2017
Steven Kwan extended his postseason hitting streak to 10 games to tie Kenny Lofton for the longest in Cleveland history
Key Match Events: Lane Thomas' grand slam highlighted the big inning for the Guardians, scoring Gimenez and giving the Guardians a 5-1 lead
The Tigers were not intimidated by the 5-1 deficit and made a comeback, but the Guardians maintained their lead
Brayan Rocchio made it 7-3 with a single in the eighth
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Stephen Vogt was confident that the Guardians would advance to the ALCS, saying 'You have to believe. If you don't believe in your group, don't even show up.'
Vogt emphasized that the Guardians are a team that finds a way to win, saying 'This is who we are.'
Post-Match Reflections: Vogt praised the Tigers, saying 'I have so much respect for A.J. Hinch and the Tigers. It was such a fun series.'
Vogt noted that the series was indicative of the Guardians' matchups throughout the regular season, saying 'It's kind of whoever got the big hit was going to win.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Guardians will face the Yankees in Game 1 of the ALCS on Monday at 7:38 p.m.
The series was a back-and-forth affair, with the Tigers taking a 1-0 lead in the fifth but the Guardians countering with five runs in the bottom of the fifth
The Guardians hit.234 (39 for 167) with 19 runs and four homers in the ALDS, while the Tigers hit.214 (34 for 159) with 13 runs and two homers
